subject: Automobile Racing
Suspensions, Dismissals and Resignations
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Nascar suspended the driver Carl Long for the next 12 Sprint Cup races and fined the crew chief Charles Swing $200,000, the largest penalty in the sport’s history. Swing also was suspended until Aug. 18 for using an engine that was too big last weekend at Lowe’s Motor Speedway in Charlotte, N.C. Long was docked a Nascar-record 200 points.
